briefdescription.para: Write a contiguous chunk of real particle data to an HDF5 file.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the start of the buffer to write
The number of elements to write
The HDF5 file into which to write the data

briefdescription.para: Read a contiguous chunk of real particle data from an istream.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the start of the buffer into which to read
The number of elements to read
The istream from which to read the data
A RealDescriptor describing the type of the floating point data

briefdescription.para: Writes a particle checkpoint to file, suitable for restarting.

parameterdescription.para: The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &dir, const std::string &name, bool is_checkpoint, const Vector< std::string > &real_comp_names=Vector< std::string >(), const Vector< std::string > &int_comp_names=Vector< std::string >()) const
memberdef.name: CheckpointHDF5

briefdescription.para: Writes a particle checkpoint to file, suitable for restarting.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &dir, const std::string &name, const Vector< int > &write_real_comp, const Vector< int > &write_int_comp, const Vector< std::string > &real_comp_names, const Vector< std::string > &int_comp_names, F &&f) const
memberdef.name: WriteHDF5ParticleData

briefdescription.para: Writes particle data to disk in the AMReX native format.

parameterdescription.para: function type
The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
for each real component, whether or not we include that component in the file
for each integer component, whether or not we include that component in the file
for each real component, a name to label the data with
for each integer component, a name to label the data with
callable that returns whether a given particle should be written or not
The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
Whether the particle id and cpu are included in the file.

briefdescription.para: This version of WritePlotFile writes all components and assigns component names.

parameterdescription.para: The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")

briefdescription.para: This version of WritePlotFile writes all components and assigns component names.

detaileddescription.para: This version also lets you pass in a functor to toggle whether each particle gets output.

parameterdescription.para: function type
The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
callable that returns whether or not to write each particle

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &dir, const std::string &name, const Vector< std::string > &real_comp_names, const Vector< std::string > &int_comp_names) const

The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
for each real component, whether to include that comp in the file
for each integer component, whether to include that comp in the file

detaileddescription.para: This version also lets you pass in a functor to toggle whether each particle gets output.

parameterdescription.para: function type
The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
for each real component, whether to include that comp in the file
for each integer component, whether to include that comp in the file
callable that returns whether or not to write each particle

briefdescription.para: This is the most general version of WritePlotFile, which takes component names and flags for whether to write each variable as components. Note that the user should pass in vectors containing names of all the components, whether they are written or not.

parameterdescription.para: The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
for each real component, whether to include that comp in the file
for each integer component, whether to include that comp in the file
for each real component, a name to label the data with
for each integer component, a name to label the data with

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &dir, const std::string &name, const Vector< int > &write_real_comp, const Vector< int > &write_int_comp, const Vector< std::string > &real_comp_names, const Vector< std::string > &int_comp_names, F &&f) const
memberdef.name: WritePlotFileHDF5

briefdescription.para: This is the most general version of WritePlotFile, which takes component names and flags for whether to write each variable as components. Note that the user should pass in vectors containing names of all the components, whether they are written or not.

detaileddescription.para: This version also lets you pass in a functor to toggle whether each particle gets output.

parameterdescription.para: function type
The base directory into which to write (i.e. "plt00000")
The name of the sub-directory for this particle type (i.e. "Tracer")
for each real component, whether to include that comp in the file
for each integer component, whether to include that comp in the file
for each real component, a name to label the data with
for each integer component, a name to label the data with
callable that returns whether or not to write each particle

memberdef.name: WriteParticlesHDF5

param.type: const Vector< std::map< std::pair< int, int >, IntVector >> &
